questions.text: What type of business do you run?
questions.help_text: Select the option that best describes your primary revenue model
questions.why_this_matters: Different attraction offers work better for different business models. For example, 'Buy X Get Y Free' works great for physical products, while 'Free With Consumption' is ideal for SaaS.

options.label: Digital Product
options.description: Online courses, ebooks, templates, digital downloads

options.label: Physical Product
options.description: Tangible products that ship to customers

options.label: Membership / Subscription
options.description: Recurring access to content, community, or services

options.label: Agency / Done-For-You
options.description: Services where you do the work for clients

questions.text: What best describes your average gross margin?
questions.help_text: Gross margin = (Revenue - Cost of Goods Sold) / Revenue. If you sell something for $100 and it costs you $20 to deliver, your gross margin is 80%.
questions.why_this_matters: Some attraction offers (like Win Your Money Back or Buy X Get Y Free) require high margins to be profitable. Lower margin businesses need to focus on volume or backend monetization.

options.label: Under 40%
options.description: Lower margin, higher cost to deliver
options.warning: Most attraction offers require higher margins. Consider focusing on volume-based offers or improving margins first.

options.tip: You have decent flexibility. Focus on offers that don't require giving away too much free.
Strong position for most attraction offers including bonuses and giveaways.
You can afford to be generous with free trials, bonuses, and refund guarantees.

questions.text: What best describes your cashflow tolerance for front-end offers?
questions.help_text: Can you afford to break even or lose money on the initial sale, making it up on the backend? Or do you need to profit immediately?
questions.why_this_matters: Offers like 'Pay Later' or 'Win Your Money Back' delay revenue. If you need immediate cashflow, you'll need different strategies.

options.label: Must profit on front-end
options.description: I need to make money immediately on each sale
options.impact: Limits you to decoy offers and immediate payment options

options.label: Break-even is okay
options.description: I can break even upfront if there's backend potential
options.impact: Opens up more attraction offer possibilities

options.label: Can afford short-term loss
options.description: I can invest in customer acquisition

options.label: Can run free front-end
options.description: I can give away significant value for free
options.impact: Unlocks all attraction offer strategies including giveaways

questions.text: How much new customer volume can you handle right now?
questions.help_text: If your attraction offer works, how many new customers can you actually serve without breaking your systems or quality?
questions.why_this_matters: Giveaways and 'Buy X Get Y' offers can bring massive volume. Win Your Money Back and high-touch offers need controlled capacity.

options.label: High capacity - can handle big spike
options.best_for: Volume offers like giveaways and bundles

options.label: Moderate capacity - some limitations
options.description: Can grow but need time to scale

options.label: Low capacity - can only take a few
No capacity - need to control volume
options.description: At or near max capacity now

questions.text: How well can you track user outcomes or progress?
questions.help_text: Can you measure whether customers complete actions, achieve results, or hit milestones? This is CRITICAL for Win Your Money Back offers.
questions.why_this_matters: Win Your Money Back requires reliable tracking. Free challenges need progress monitoring. If you can't track, you're limited to simpler offers.

options.label: Can track everything
options.description: Automated systems, clear metrics, reliable data
options.unlocks: Win Your Money Back, All challenge-based offers

options.label: Can track some things
options.unlocks: Most offers except strict Win Your Money Back

options.label: Tracking is difficult
options.description: Hard to measure or verify outcomes
options.warning: Avoid offers that depend on tracking completion

options.label: Cannot track results at all
options.warning: Limited to giveaways, simple discounts, and free trials

questions.text: What is your biggest challenge with leads right now?
questions.help_text: What's the main obstacle preventing leads from becoming customers?
questions.why_this_matters: Each attraction offer solves a specific lead problem. No leads? Giveaway. No trust? Free trial. Price sensitive? Decoy pricing.

options.label: Not enough leads
options.description: Need more people to enter the funnel
options.best_solution: Giveaways, Buy X Get Y Free - volume plays

options.label: Leads don't trust me yet
options.description: People are skeptical or need proof
options.best_solution: Win Your Money Back, Free With Consumption - build trust through experience

options.label: Leads are price sensitive
options.best_solution: Decoy Offer, Pay Less Now/More Later - reframe the value

options.label: Slow or unclear sales cycle
options.best_solution: Pay Less Now/More Later, Decoy - create urgency

options.label: Low quality leads
options.best_solution: Decoy Offer, Win Your Money Back - self-select quality

options.label: None of the above
options.description: Different challenge or no major issue

questions.text: How strong is your back-end monetization?
questions.help_text: After someone buys your front-end offer, what else can you sell them? This is CRITICAL for most attraction offers.
questions.why_this_matters: Most attraction offers make money on the backend. Without upsells, you can only use offers that profit upfront.

options.label: Multiple strong upsells
options.description: Several proven offers that convert well

options.label: One strong backend offer
examples: Free trial that converts to paid

options.label: Weak backend, working on it
options.warning: Focus on building backend before aggressive front-end offers

options.label: No backend offer yet
options.warning: Build backend monetization FIRST, then create attraction offer

questions.text: How often do customers buy from you again or consume repeatedly?
questions.help_text: Is this a one-time purchase or do customers come back for more?
questions.why_this_matters: Buy X Get Y Free works best with repeat purchases. Win Your Money Back leverages repeated consumption to generate testimonials.

options.label: Frequent repurchase/consumption
options.advantage: Perfect for Buy X Get Y Free and subscription offers

options.label: Rare repeat purchase
options.description: Customers might buy again but infrequently
options.impact: Focus on backend upsells rather than repeat of same product

options.label: One-time purchase only
options.description: Customers typically only buy once ever
options.impact: Need strong backend with different offers

questions.text: What is your primary goal for the attraction offer?
questions.help_text: What's the #1 outcome you want from this front-end offer?
questions.why_this_matters: Your goal determines which offer to use. Lead volume? Giveaway. Testimonials? Win Your Money Back. Fill cohort? Urgency-based offers.

options.label: Generate testimonials & case studies
options.description: Get social proof and success stories

options.label: Fill a program or cohort
options.description: Fill limited spots by specific deadline

questions.text: What type of leads do you most want from this offer?
questions.help_text: Would you rather have 1,000 okay leads or 50 perfect leads?
questions.why_this_matters: Volume offers (giveaways) attract many leads. Quality offers (decoy, Win Your Money Back) attract fewer but more committed leads.

options.label: As many leads as possible
options.description: Volume over quality - we'll nurture them

options.label: Fewer but higher quality leads
options.description: Quality over quantity - serious buyers only

options.label: Balanced mix of volume and quality
